info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otsego, southeastern Broome, northwestern Delaware, southeastern Chenango, eastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near West End to near Hop Bottom. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Sidney, Jackson, Sanford, Susquehanna, Maryland, Deposit, Susquehanna Depot, Dimock and Harford. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 80 and 84. Interstate 88 between 9 and 17. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 223. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and visibilities will be produced.
